intro: Echidnopsis mariae, commonly known as the Cape Hottentot, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with fleshy, ribbed leaves that help store water. Echidnopsis mariae is well adapted to rocky soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens.
